test-case.name: try-002
test-case.test: declare namespace err = "http://www.w3.org/2005/xqt-errors"; try { doc('rubbish.xml') } catch err:FODC0001 | err:FODC0002 | err:FODC0005 {"ok"}

test-case.name: try-004
try-005
test-case.description: test try/catch as an ExprSingle
test-case.test: <out>{ try { doc('rubbish.xml') } catch * {<caught-error/>}, try { doc('rubbish.xml') } catch * {<caught-another/>} }</out>

test-case.name: try-006
test-case.description: try/catch doesn't catch error evaluating global variable

test-case.name: try-007
test-case.description: doesn't catch error evaluating local variable

test-case.name: try-008
test-case.description: does catch error evaluating function call
test-case.test: declare function local:f() { doc('rubbish.xml') }; try { local:f() } catch * {"ok"}

test-case.name: try-009
test-case.description: does catch error evaluating function call
test-case.test: declare function local:f($d as xs:integer) { 10 div $d }; try { local:f(0) } catch err:FOAR0001 {"ok"}

test-case.name: try-010
test-case.description: Use err:code local variable, implicitly declared
test-case.test: declare function local:f($d as xs:integer) { 10 div $d }; try { local:f(0) } catch * {local-name-from-QName($err:code)}

test-case.name: try-011
test-case.description: Use err:code local variable in a nested tryCatch. The cast as expr should throw a dynamic error

test-case.name: try-012
test-case.description: Use err:description local variable, implicitly declared
test-case.test: declare function local:f($d as xs:integer) { 10 div $d }; try { local:f(0) } catch * {$err:description}

test-case.name: try-013
test-case.description: Use err:value, err:line-number and err:column-number local variable, implicitly declared
test-case.test: declare function local:f($d as xs:integer) { 10 div $d }; try { local:f(0) } catch * {$err:column-number, $err:line-number, $err:line-number}

test-case.name: try-014
test-case.description: Integer literal out of range is a dynamic error

test-case.name: try-015
test-case.description: Bad date is a dynamic error

test-case.name: try-016
test-case.description: No context item is a dynamic error
test-case.test: declare function local:f() { .+3 }; try {local:f()} catch err:XPDY0002 {true()}

test-case.name: try-017
test-case.description: No context item is a dynamic error (but no context node is a type error...)

modified.change: Expected error conditions. The two possible conditions to report are XPDY0002 (the context item is absent) and XPTY0020 (the context item is not a node). Both conditions are true, but for some reason one of them is a dynamic error and the other is a type error. If a type error is reported, it should be XPTY0020 and not XPTY0004. Note, however, many other tests in the test suite require XPDY0002 here (for example prod-AxisStep/K2-Steps-1), which prevents static reporting of the error.

test-case.test: declare function local:f() { a }; try {local:f()} catch err:XPDY0002 {true()}

test-case.name: try-018
test-case.description: Test that the right catch clause is evaluated. Saxon bug report from Florent Georges

test-case.name: try-019
test-case.description: Empty try expression

test-case.name: try-020
test-case.description: Empty catch expression

test-case.name: try-021
test-case.description: Use err:additional: value is implementation-defined, but variable must exist
test-case.test: declare function local:f($d as xs:integer) { 10 div $d }; try { local:f(0) } catch * {"caught " || count($err:additional)}

test-case.name: no-try-catch-1
test-case.description: Without try catch a division by 0 raises a dynamic error.

test-case.name: no-try-catch-2
test-case.description: Without try catch an undefined variable raises a static error.

test-case.name: no-try-catch-3
test-case.description: Without try catch a static type mismatch raises a type error.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-1
test-case.description: A division by zero (dynamic error) is caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-2
test-case.description: A division by zero (dynamic error) is caught when the error is specified.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-3
test-case.description: A division by zero (dynamic error) is caught when the error namespace is specified.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:* { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-4
test-case.description: A division by zero (dynamic error) is caught when the error local name is specified.

test-case.name: try-catch-static-error-1
test-case.description: An undefined variable (static error) is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-static-error-2
test-case.description: An undefined variable (static error) is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-static-error-3
test-case.description: An undefined variable (static error) is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-static-error-4
test-case.description: An undefined variable (static error) is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-type-error-1
test-case.description: A static type mismatch (type error) is caught.
test-case.test: try { let $i as xs:string := 1 return $i } catch * { "Type error" }

test-case.name: try-catch-type-error-2
test-case.description: A static type mismatch (type error) is caught.
test-case.test: try { let $i as xs:string := 1 return $i } catch err:XPTY0004 { "Type error" }

test-case.name: try-catch-type-error-3
test-case.description: A static type mismatch (type error) is caught.
test-case.test: try { let $i as xs:string := 1 return $i } catch err:* { "Type error" }

test-case.name: try-catch-type-error-4
test-case.description: A static type mismatch (type error) is caught.
test-case.test: try { let $i as xs:string := 1 return $i } catch *:XPTY0004 { "Type error" }

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-before-1
test-case.description: A dynamic error before a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-before-2
test-case.description: A dynamic error before a try catch expression is not caught.
test-case.test: 1 div 0, try { () } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-before-3
test-case.description: A dynamic error before a try catch expression is not caught.
test-case.test: 1 div 0, try { () } catch err:* { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-before-4
test-case.description: A dynamic error before a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-after-1
test-case.description: A dynamic error after a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-after-2
test-case.description: A dynamic error after a try catch expression is not caught.
test-case.test: try { () } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Division by zero" }, 1 div 0

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-after-3
test-case.description: A dynamic error after a try catch expression is not caught.
test-case.test: try { () } catch err:* { "Division by zero" }, 1 div 0

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-after-4
test-case.description: A dynamic error after a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-1
test-case.description: A dynamic error outside a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-2
test-case.description: A dynamic error outside a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-3
test-case.description: A dynamic error outside a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-4
test-case.description: A dynamic error outside a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-5
test-case.description: A dynamic error outside a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-6
test-case.description: A dynamic error outside a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-7
test-case.description: A dynamic error outside a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-dynamic-error-outside-8
test-case.description: A dynamic error outside a try catch expression is not caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-no-error-1
test-case.description: If no error is raised, the result of the try catch expression is the result of the try clause.

test-case.name: try-catch-no-error-2
test-case.description: If no error is raised, the result of the try catch expression is the result of the try clause.

test-case.name: try-catch-no-error-3
test-case.description: If no error is raised, the result of the try catch expression is the result of the try clause.

test-case.name: try-catch-no-error-4
test-case.description: If no error is raised, the result of the try catch expression is the result of the try clause.

test-case.name: try-catch-no-error-5
test-case.description: If no error is raised, the result of the try catch expression is the result of the try clause.
test-case.test: try { 0 } catch err:FOAR0001 { "No error" } catch *:FOAR0001 { "No error "} catch err:* { "No error "} catch * { "No error "}

test-case.name: try-catch-name-tests-namespace-1
test-case.description: URI literals are supported in name tests.

test-case.name: try-catch-name-tests-namespace-2
test-case.description: URI literals are supported in name tests.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch Q{http://www.w3.org/2005/xqt-errors}* { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-name-no-matching-catch-clause-1
test-case.description: If there is no matching catch clause, the error is forwarded.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:XPST0008 { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-name-no-matching-catch-clause-2
test-case.description: If there is no matching catch clause, the error is forwarded.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch xs:* { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-name-no-matching-catch-clause-3
test-case.description: If there is no matching catch clause, the error is forwarded.

test-case.name: try-catch-name-no-matching-catch-clause-4
test-case.description: If there is no matching catch clause, the error is forwarded.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch Q{http://www.w3.org/2005/not-xqt-errors}* { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-name-no-matching-catch-clause-5
test-case.description: If there is no matching catch clause, the error is forwarded.

test-case.name: try-catch-name-no-matching-catch-clause-6
test-case.description: If there is no matching catch clause, the error is forwarded.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:XPST0008 { "Division by zero" } catch xs:* { "Division by zero" } catch *:XPST0008 { "Division by zero" } catch Q{http://www.w3.org/2005/not-xqt-errors}* { "Division by zero" } catch Q{http://www.w3.org/2005/xqt-errors}XPST0008 { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-several-name-tests-1
test-case.description: A catch clause with one or more NameTests matches any error whose error code matches one of these NameTests.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:XPST0008 | err:FOAR0001 { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-several-name-tests-2
test-case.description: A catch clause with one or more NameTests matches any error whose error code matches one of these NameTests.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:FOAR0001 | err:XPST0008 { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-several-name-tests-3
test-case.description: A catch clause with one or more NameTests matches any error whose error code matches one of these NameTests.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:XPTY0004 | err:FOAR0001 | err:XPST0008 { "Division by zero" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-1
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Clause 1" } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Clause 2" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-2
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:XQST008 { "Clause 1" } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Clause 2" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-3
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Clause 1" } catch err:XQST008 { "Clause 2" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-4
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Clause 1" } catch err:XQST008 { "Clause 2" } catch err:XPTY0004 { "Clause 3" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-5
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Clause 1" } catch err:XPTY0004 { "Clause 2" } catch err:XQST008 { "Clause 3" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-6
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:XPTY0004 { "Clause 1" } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Clause 2" } catch err:XQST008 { "Clause 3" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-7
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:XPTY0004 { "Clause 1" } catch err:XPST0008 { "Clause 2" } catch err:FOAR0001 { "Clause 3" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-8
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch err:* { "Clause 1" } catch xs:* { "Clause 2" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-9
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch xs:* { "Clause 1" } catch err:* { "Clause 2" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-10
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch Q{http://www.w3.org/2005/xqt-errors}* { "Clause 1" } catch Q{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}* { "Clause 2" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-11
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch Q{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}* { "Clause 1" } catch Q{http://www.w3.org/2005/xqt-errors}* { "Clause 2" }

test-case.name: try-catch-first-matching-catch-clause-12
test-case.description: The first matching catch clause is used.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-1
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-2
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-3
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-4
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-5
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-6
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-7
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-8
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-9
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-10
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-11
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-12
test-case.description: err:code returns the error code.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-13
test-case.description: err:code used within an "AVT".

test-case.name: try-catch-err-code-variable-14
test-case.description: err:code used in a loop (test case from Gunther Rademacher). See Saxon bug 2181: Saxon was loop-lifting the variable references out of the for loop.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-description-variable-1
test-case.description: err:description returns a description string or the empty sequence.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-description-variable-2
test-case.description: err:code returns a description string or the empty sequence.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch * { if (($err:description)) then $err:description instance of xs:string else fn:true() }

test-case.name: try-catch-err-description-variable-3
test-case.description: err:code returns a description string or the empty sequence.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-value-variable-1
test-case.description: err:value returns a sequence of error values.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-value-variable-2
test-case.description: err:value returns a sequence of error values.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-value-variable-3
test-case.description: err:value returns a sequence of error values.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-module-variable-1
test-case.description: err:module must be defined.
test-case.test: try { fn:error() } catch * { let $n := $err:module return true() }

test-case.name: try-catch-err-module-variable-2
test-case.description: err:module must be defined.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-module-variable-3
test-case.description: err:module must be a string if it is not empty.
test-case.test: try { fn:error() } catch * { if (count($err:module) eq 1) then $err:module else "" }

test-case.name: try-catch-err-line-number-variable-1
test-case.description: err:line-number must be defined.
test-case.test: try { fn:error() } catch * { let $n := $err:line-number return true() }

test-case.name: try-catch-err-line-number-variable-2
test-case.description: err:line-number must be defined.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-line-number-variable-3
test-case.description: err:line-number must be an integer if it is not empty.
test-case.test: try { fn:error() } catch * { if (count($err:line-number) eq 1) then $err:line-number else 0 }

test-case.name: try-catch-err-column-number-variable-1
test-case.description: err:column-number must be defined.
test-case.test: try { fn:error() } catch * { let $n := $err:column-number return true() }

test-case.name: try-catch-err-column-number-variable-2
test-case.description: err:column-number must be defined.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-column-number-variable-3
test-case.description: err:column-number must be an integer if it is not empty.
test-case.test: try { fn:error() } catch * { if (count($err:column-number) eq 1) then $err:column-number else 0 }

test-case.name: try-catch-err-other-variable-1
test-case.description: err:other must not be defined.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-dynamic-error-in-catch-clause-1
test-case.description: A dynamic error raised by the chosen catch clause must be thrown.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-dynamic-error-in-catch-clause-2
test-case.description: A dynamic error raised by a non-executed catch clause must be ignored.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-dynamic-error-in-catch-clause-3
test-case.description: A dynamic error raised by a non-executed catch clause must be ignored.

test-case.name: try-catch-err-dynamic-error-in-catch-clause-4
test-case.description: A dynamic error raised by a non-executed catch clause must be ignored.
test-case.test: try { fn:error() } catch err:FOER0001 { fn:error() } catch err:FOER0000 { 0 }

test-case.name: try-catch-err-dynamic-error-in-catch-clause-5
test-case.description: A dynamic error raised by a non-executed catch clause must be ignored.
test-case.test: try { fn:error() } catch err:FOER0000 { 0 } catch err:FOER0001 { fn:error() }

test-case.name: try-catch-function-call-1
test-case.description: If a function call occurs within a try clause, errors raised by evaluating the corresponding function are caught by the try/catch expression.

test-case.name: try-catch-function-call-2
test-case.description: If a function call occurs within a try clause, errors raised by evaluating the corresponding function are caught by the try/catch expression.

test-case.name: try-catch-function-call-3
test-case.description: If a function call occurs within a try clause, errors raised by evaluating the corresponding function are caught by the try/catch expression.

test-case.name: try-catch-function-call-4
test-case.description: If a function call occurs within a try clause, errors raised by evaluating the corresponding function are caught by the try/catch expression.

test-case.name: try-catch-error-function-with-static-error-code
test-case.description: An error raised with fn:error() must be handled as a dynamic error.

test-case.name: try-catch-variable-binding-outside-1
test-case.description: If a variable reference is used in a try clause, errors raised by binding a value to the variable are not caught unless the binding expression occurs within the try clause.
test-case.test: let $x as xs:integer := "" return try { $x } catch err:XPTY0004 { 0 }

test-case.name: try-catch-variable-binding-outside-2
test-case.description: If a variable reference is used in a try clause, errors raised by binding a value to the variable are not caught unless the binding expression occurs within the try clause.
test-case.test: try { let $x as xs:integer := "" return $x } catch err:XPTY0004 { 0 }

test-case.name: try-catch-variable-binding-outside-3
test-case.description: If a variable reference is used in a try clause, errors raised by binding a value to the variable are not caught unless the binding expression occurs within the try clause.
test-case.test: for $x as xs:integer in (0, 1, "") return try { $x } catch err:XPTY0004 { 0 }

test-case.name: try-catch-variable-binding-outside-4
test-case.description: If a variable reference is used in a try clause, errors raised by binding a value to the variable are not caught unless the binding expression occurs within the try clause.

test-case.name: try-catch-variable-binding-outside-5
test-case.description: If a variable reference is used in a try clause, errors raised by binding a value to the variable are not caught unless the binding expression occurs within the try clause.

test-case.name: try-catch-variable-binding-outside-6
test-case.description: If a variable reference is used in a try clause, errors raised by binding a value to the variable are not caught unless the binding expression occurs within the try clause.

test-case.name: try-catch-optimizations-1
test-case.description: If the evaluation of an expression inside a try/catch is rewritten or deferred in this way, it must take its try/catch context with it.
test-case.test: try { 1 div 0 } catch * { 0 }, try { 1 div 0 } catch err:FOAR0001 { 1}

test-case.name: try-catch-optimizations-2
test-case.description: If the evaluation of an expression inside a try/catch is rewritten or deferred in this way, it must take its try/catch context with it.
test-case.test: try { fn:error() } catch * { 0 }, try { fn:error() } catch err:FOER0000 { 1}

test-case.name: try-catch-optimizations-3
test-case.description: Expressions that were written outside the try/catch expression may be evaluated inside the try/catch, but only if they retain their original try/catch behavior.

test-case.name: try-catch-spec-example-1
test-case.description: Example from the specification.

test-case.name: try-catch-spec-example-2
test-case.description: Example from the specification.

test-case.name: try-catch-spec-example-3
test-case.description: Example from the specification.

test-case.name: try-catch-spec-example-4
test-case.description: Example from the specification (must parse).

test-case.name: try-catch-spec-example-5
test-case.description: Example from the specification.

test-case.name: try-catch-function-result-type-1
test-case.description: Can't catch this error within the function body

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-1
test-case.description: XPDY0002 must be caught.
test-case.test: try { . } catch err:XPDY0002 { "Context item not set." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-2
test-case.description: XPDY0050 must be caught.
test-case.test: try { "" treat as element() } catch err:XPDY0050 { "Sequence type mismatch." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-3
test-case.description: XQDY0025 must be caught.
test-case.test: try { element element { attribute a {""}, attribute a {""} } } catch err:XQDY0025 { "Attribute name duplicate." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-4
test-case.description: XQDY0026 must be caught.
test-case.test: try { processing-instruction name { "?>" } } catch err:XQDY0026 { "Invalid PI." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-5
test-case.description: XQDY0041 must be caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-6
test-case.description: XQDY0044 must be caught.
test-case.test: try { attribute xmlns {} } catch err:XQDY0044 { "Invalid attribute." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-7
test-case.description: XQDY0061 must be caught.
test-case.test: try { validate { document { <a/>, <b/> }} } catch err:XQDY0061 { "Invalid document." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-8
test-case.description: XQDY0064 must be caught.
test-case.test: try { processing-instruction XML {} } catch err:XQDY0064 { "Invalid PI." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-9
test-case.description: XQDY0072 must be caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-10
test-case.description: XQDY0074 must be caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-11
test-case.description: XQDY0091 must be caught.

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-12
test-case.description: XQDY0095 must be caught.
test-case.test: try { let $x := (1,2)[position() < 3] group by $x return $x } catch err:XPTY0004 { "More than a grouping item." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-13
test-case.description: XQDY0096 must be caught.

modified.change: catch XQDY0074 as well, which is a reasonable error to raise since 'xmlns' is not declared in the static context

test-case.test: try { element { "xmlns:name" } {} } catch err:XQDY0096 | err:XQDY0074 { "Invalid element." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-13b
test-case.description: XQDY0096 must be caught.
test-case.test: try { element { QName("http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/", "xmlns:name") } {} } catch err:XQDY0096 { "Invalid element." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-14
test-case.description: XQDY0101 must be caught.
test-case.test: try { namespace xmlns { "http://www.example.com" } } catch err:XQDY0101 { "Invalid namespace node." }

test-case.name: try-catch-all-dynamic-errors-caught-15
test-case.description: FAOR0002 must be caught, even when detectable statically.

test-case.name: try-catch-nest-1
test-case.description: Try-catch expressions must nest.
test-case.test: try { try { 1 div 0 } catch * { "Division by zero" } } catch * { "Should not be reached." }

test-case.name: try-catch-nest-2
test-case.description: Try-catch expressions must nest.
test-case.test: try { fn:error() } catch * { try { 1 div 0 } catch * { "Division by zero" } }

test-case.name: try-catch-fn-error-1
test-case.description: Try-catch must match fn:error semantics.

test-case.name: try-catch-fn-error-2
test-case.description: Try-catch must match fn:error semantics.
